pages.text: This is a basic block of text. The formatting rules allow the text become $(l)bold$() or $(o)italic$(). It is also possible to put a $(m)strikethrough$() in the text.$(br2)The formatting also allows links to be put into the book. These links are either $(l:page_types/page02)internal$(), meaning that they link to other pages, or $(l:https://github.com/Vazkii/Patchouli/wiki)external$(), meaning that they link to websites.
You will need to be specific on what you put on each page or else the text will run off the bottom of the screen and that looks messy.

If you need to organize your text into a bulleted list, you can do that here.$(br2)$(li)Here is a list.$(li2)Here is a nested list.$(li3)... and here is another nested list.$(br2)You can also add a little personal touch by having the book to print out the player's name.$(br2)$(o)"Hello, $(playername)!"$()

$(l)What about colors?$()$(br)There are three ways to color your text. The first option is to use a code 0-f to choose from the standard 16 colors. The second option is to use a hex code such as, #ff0000, to choose a specific color. Alternatively, you can use an RGB code such as, #f00, to make a color selection.$(br2)$(li)$(c)This red text was chosen with a default code.$()$(li)$(#ff0000)This red text was chosen using a Hex code.$()$(li)$(#f00)This red text was chosen using an RGB code.$()
